Articles.Content:
Is there a way to start on the launch pad/landing strip with STRUTS extended? A mod, perhaps?

I'm working on some sci-fi type ships with VTOL and hovering, and it would be better if I could start them in their landed state rather than launch them like a rocket or plane.
Not that i'm aware of, you could just use launch clamps to hold them up ,then extend the struts. But maybe you already did that, idk.
I hadn't even thought of using the launch clamps to hold it up to extend them... XD

Yup, just put the clamps on it and lower the legs.

You can even drop the lander from the clamps to test the legs.

I use this technique extensively to "drop test" various landers and rovers to determine how resistant they are to impact.
Unless the ship is big, the landing legs are probably strong enough to stand the thing up when you extend them.

Exactly what I am doing for my Dres Science Mission at the moment. You get the advantage of testing the strength of the legs as well as the ground clearance.

AFAIK toggling parts in the VAB/SPH is a planned feature. Until it is implemented it is not possible to start with legs and ladders deployed or landing gear retracted.

However, a mod like B9 does have this feature for it's own parts.

I'd like to know more about that last statement. I sometimes use the landing legs from the latest b9 pack and would love to know how to start with them deployed.

Actually, the B9 landing legs are the only B9 parts that can NOT be toggled before launch.

Since many of the new B9 parts do have this feature I wrongly assumed the landing legs would too.
